author: Brooks Atkinson

quoteText: I cannot comprehend how any man can want anything but the truth.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quoteText: Anyone unwilling to give you your day in court when confronted with facts is an enemy of the truth.
author: Claston Bernard

quoteText: The world wants to be deceived.  The truth is too complex and frightening.  The taste for the truth is an acquired taste that few acquire.
author: Martin Buber

quoteText: Truth tellers always look crazy when the world is used to lies.
author: Bryson Gray

quoteText: Truth would become more popular if it were not always stating ugly facts.
author: Henry S. Haskins

quoteText: Americans detest all lies except lies spoken in public or printed lies.
author: Edgar Watson Howe

quoteText: Great is truth, but still greater from a practical point of view, is silence about truth.
author: Aldous Huxley

quoteText: Truth is now a hate crime.
author: Anna Khait

quoteText: People dontt ask for the facts in making up their mind.  They would rather have one good soul-satisfying emotion than a dozen facts.
author: Robert Keith Leavitt

quoteText: The men the American people admire most extravagantly are the most daring liars; the men they detest most violently are those who try to tell them the truth.
author: H.L. Mencken

quoteText: The truth forces you to examine your truths.  For Democrats, the truth seems to force them to double down on their lies.
author: Ron Milner

quoteText: Sometimes people don`t want to hear the truth because they don't want their illusions destroyed.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quoteText: The very concept of objective truth is fading out of the world. Lies will pass into history.
author: George Orwell

quoteText: The further a society drifts from truth, the more it will hate those who speak it.
author: George Orwell

quoteText: We are treated as we wish to be treated.  We hate the truth and it is hid from us . . . We like to be deceived and we are deceived.
author: Blaise Pascal

quoteText: Pretending that you believe a liar is also a lie.
author: Arthur Schnitzler

quoteText: The hypocrite recognizes the honest man as his deadly enemy.
author: Joseph Sobran

quoteText: It is usually futile to try to talk facts . . . to people who are enjoying a sense of moral superiority in their ignorance.
author: Dr. Thomas Sowell

quoteText: When people want the impossible, only liars will satisfy them.
author: Dr. Thomas Sowell

quoteText: When we were kids, we were punished for lying. Now, we are punished for telling the truth.
author: Zuby @ZubyMusic

quoteText: Anyone who can walk to the welfare office can walk to work.
author: Al Capp

quoteText: There is no use whatever trying to help people who do not help themselves. You cannot push anyone up a ladder.
author: Andrew Carnegie

quoteText: I would never allow anyone to give me money, no difference how badly I needed it. I wanted literally to earn my living.
author: George Washington Carver

quoteText: Private charity discourages poverty while public subsidies encourage it.
author: James R. Cook

quoteText: The evidence is thus crystal-clear. Modern welfare destroys. It does not build competence; it creates dependence. It does not alleviate poverty.
author: Peter Drucker

quoteText: I believe welfare makes you lazy and unproductive.
author: Charles Evers

quoteText: You want to be a country that creates food stamps?  . . .  Or do you want to be a country that creates job?
author: Newt Gingrich

quoteText: The majority of Aboriginals do not want handouts because they realize that welfare is killing them.
author: Pauline Hanson

quoteText: Relief, or redistribution of income, voluntary or coerced, is never the true solution of poverty, but at best a makeshift, which may mask the disease and mitigate the pain, but provides no basic cure.
author: Henry Hazlitt

quoteText: I'm calling on our government to make welfare as hard to get as veteran benefits.
author: Mark Lutchman

quoteText: Hard as it may appear in individual cases, dependent poverty ought to be held disgraceful.
author: Thomas Malthus

quoteText: At its core, government welfare is predicated on a false compassion.
author: Stephen Moore

quoteText: The real purpose of welfare is to get rid of poor people entirely.  Everybody knows welfare has bad effects; that's the point.
author: P.J. O'Rourke

quoteText: We should measure welfare's success by how many people leave welfare, not by how many are added.
author: Ronald Reagan

quoteText: Welfare's purpose should be to eliminate, as far as possible, the need for its own existence.
author: Ronald Reagan

quoteText: The greatest crime of welfare isn't that it's a waste of money, but that it's a waste of people.
author: Mark Steyn

quoteText: The purpose of a just government is to prevent plunder, not facilitate it.
author: Glenn Beck

quoteText: Anyone who doesn't think the welfare-industrial complex is trying to increase dependency isn't paying attention.
author: Howie Carr

quoteText: That's the definition of 'success' for the modern Democrat Party.  As many people dependent on government as possible is the objective.
author: Rush Limbaugh

quoteText: The tax money belongs to the taxpayers. It doesn't belong to the bureaucracy. And government is not a welfare system.
author: Bruce Rauner

quoteText: Poverty is a career for lots of well-paid people.
author: Ronald Reagan

quoteText: Seventy cents of every dollar for the last 50 years, of the 22 trillion spent on poverty, went not to the poor but those who serve poor people.
author: Bob Woodson

quoteText: The more people expect from government, the more biased they become against limiting government power.
author: James Bovard

quoteText: When the courts decide that murderers, rapists and others who maliciously break our social contract deserve health care that most Americans can't afford, they are condemning good people to death.
author: Tammy Bruce

quoteText: There will always be some who, for whatever reason, find themselves dependent on the charity of others. But when half the population is along for the ride, the system becomes dangerously out of balance. Things fall apart.
author: Tucker Carlson

quoteText: Though the people support the government, the government should not support the people.
author: Grover Cleveland

quoteText: Left-wing social policies sicken our behavior and corrupt our culture . . . Giveaway programs encourage every imaginable sort of cheating and dishonesty . . . Whenever you're dependent on the money, the end justifies the means.
author: James R. Cook

quoteText: We evolved without social welfare and we are equipped to solve our problems without it.
author: James R. Cook

quoteText: We have the right as individuals, to give away as much of our own money as we please in charity; but as members of Congress we have no right to appropriate a dollar of the public money.
author: Davy Crockett

quoteText: When you subsidize poverty and failure, you get more of both.
author: James Dale Davidson

quoteText: The welfare state has bred a generation of obnoxious, drug-addicted criminals and ne'er-do-wells.  It has also, incidentally, burdened what was the world's biggest, most dynamic economy with the dead weight of an obstructive and vastly expensive state machine.
author: Martin Durkin

quoteText: The Democrat Party is a party of handouts, and after over seven and a half years, the only thing we have left in our pockets is change.
author: Darryl Glenn

quoteText: Government relief . . . tends to reduce the incentives to work and to save, both of those who receive it and of those who are forced to pay it.
author: Henry Hazlitt

quoteText: We cannot win the weak by sharing our wealth with them.  They feel our generosity as oppression.
author: Eric Hoffer

quoteText: There is no difference in principle, ... between the economic philosophy of Nazism, socialism, communism, and fascism and that of the American welfare state and regulated economy.
author: Jacob G. Hornberger

quoteText: Let's be honest about this; the liberal agenda with failed stimulus plans and government entitlement programs is crippling our economy and our quality of life.
author: Alveda King

quoteText: Charity is no part of the legislative duty of the government.
author: James Madison

quoteText: We tried to provide more for the poor and produced more poor instead. We tried to remove the barriers to escape poverty and inadvertently built a trap.
author: Charles Murray

quoteText: Instead of solving economic problems, government welfare socialism created monstrous moral and spiritual problems - the kind of problems that are inevitable when individuals turn responsibility for their lives over to others.
author: Star Parker

quoteText: What the welfare system and other kinds of governmental programs are doing is paying people to fail.  Insofar as they fail, they receive the money; insofar as they succeed, even to a moderate extent, the money is taken away.
author: Dr. Thomas Sowell

quoteText: The welfare state has always been judged by its good intentions, rather than its bad results.
author: Dr. Thomas Sowell

quoteText: The welfare state is the oldest con game in the world. First you take people's money away quietly and then you give some of it back to them flamboyantly.
author: Dr. Thomas Sowell

quoteText: In the welfare state there are no reciprocal obligations.  You are simply subsidizing whatever people choose to do whether it's decent or indecent.  And I don't think that people who have purpose removed from their lives behave better.
author: Dr. Thomas Sowell

quoteText: The more is given the less the people will work for themselves, and the less they work the more their poverty will increase.
author: Leo Tolstoy

quoteText: One of the funniest things about 2021 is hearing that Rage Against the Machine is playing vaccine-only concerts.
author: Daniel Alexander

quoteText: Let me get this straight: the MLB moved its All-Star Game from a city with a 51% black population to a city with a 9.1% black population and removed a $100M economic investment in largely black-owned businesses - all in the name of 'fighting systemic racism.'
author: Charlie Kirk

quoteText: 49 gay Americans are killed by a Muslim in Florida and nobody blames Obama.  49 Muslims are killed by an eco-fascist (liberal) in New Zealand and everybody blames Trump.
author: Mark Lutchman

quoteText: Twitter blocked access to its platform to the President of Nigeria.  Nigeria countered by blocking Twitter from its country.  Twitter responded with a Tweet that said they were 'deeply concerned by Nigeria's blocking the free & open internet.'
author: Ron Milner

quoteText: Consider how much you'd have to hate free will to come up with a political platform that advocates killing unborn babies but not convicted murderers.  A callous pragmatist might favor abortion and capital punishment.  A devout Christian would sanction neither.  But it takes years of therapy to arrive at the liberal view.
author: P.J. O'Rourke

quoteText: We live in a world where you need vaccine papers to eat inside a McDonalds, but a voter can walk into the polls, vote, and leave without verifying who he is.
author: Billy Prempeh

quoteText: Funny, the same people who want to 'defund' the police over the deaths of '9 unarmed black men' didn't want us 'jumping to conclusions' following the deaths of 2,996 people by 9 radical Islamic terrorist.
author: Mark Robinson
